parameters.name: ShortCode
parameters.description: Only show the ShortCode resources that match this pattern. You can specify partial numbers and use '*' as a wildcard for any digit.

parameters.name: FriendlyName
parameters.description: Only show the ShortCode resources with friendly names that exactly match this name.

parameters.name: company_name
parameters.description: Name of the company that owns the porting phone number. Please note that this is the name we will use to populate the “Business Name” field in the LOA associated with this port request.

parameters.name: billing_phone_number
parameters.description: The main billing phone number on the account (with your current provider/carrier) that is associated with the porting phone number in this port request. This must be in E.164 format, e.g., +16175551212.

parameters.name: account_number
parameters.description: Account number of the account (with your current provider/carrier) that is associated with the porting phone number in this port request. This is mandatory for Wireless numbers but optional for Landline and Toll Free numbers.

parameters.name: pin_number
parameters.description: PIN number of the account (with your current provider/carrier) that is associated with the porting phone number in this port request. This is mandatory for Wireless numbers but optional for Landline and Toll Free numbers.

parameters.name: ssn_last_four
parameters.description: Last four digits of the social security number of the person that owns the porting phone number. Please note that this person must be the one who is authorized to and will sign the LOA. This is mandatory for Wireless numbers but optional for Landline and Toll Free numbers.

parameters.name: activation_date
parameters.description: Desired Firm Order Commitment (FOC) date and time, given as ISO 8601 format – i.e., the date and time at which the number will port. This will be overridden if the earliest possible FOC date is on a later date.

parameters.name: status_callback
parameters.description: The URL that Twilio will POST to each time the port request status changes to one of Delivered, Failed, or Completed.

parameters.name: cc_emails
parameters.description: Array of email address(es) of the person/people whom Twilio should notify each time the port request status changes to one of Delivered, Failed, or Completed.

parameters.name: IpAddress
parameters.description: An IP address in dotted decimal notation from which you want to accept traffic. Any SIP requests from this IP address will be allowed by Twilio. IPv4 only supported today.

parameters.name: Recurring
parameters.description: Only show UsageTriggers that count over this interval. One of daily , monthly , or yearly . To retrieve non-recurring triggers, leave this empty or use alltime .

parameters.name: UsageCategory
parameters.description: Only show UsageTriggers that watch this usage category. Must be one of the supported usage categories .

parameters.name: TriggerBy
parameters.description: Only show UsageTriggers that trigger by this field in the UsageRecord. Must be one of: count , usage , or price as described in the UsageRecords documentation .

parameters.name: The password that the username will use when when authenticating SIP requests. The password must be a minimum of 12 characters, contain at least 1 digit, and have mixed case. (eg “IWasAtTwilioCon2011”)
parameters.description: The password that the username will use when when authenticating SIP requests. The password must be a minimum of 12 characters, contain at least 1 digit, and have mixed case. (eg “IWasAtTwilioCon2011”)

parameters.name: PhoneNumber
parameters.description: Only show the incoming phone number resources that match this pattern. You can specify partial numbers and use '*' as a wildcard for any digit.

parameters.name: FriendlyName
parameters.description: Only show the incoming phone number resources with friendly names that exactly match this name.

parameters.name: Beta
parameters.description: Include phone numbers new to the Twilio platform. Possible values are either true or false . Default is true .

parameters.name: Twilio will make a request to this url when the trigger fires.
parameters.description: Twilio will make a request to this url when the trigger fires.

parameters.name: The HTTP method Twilio will use when making a request to the CallbackUrl. GET or POST .
parameters.description: The HTTP method Twilio will use when making a request to the CallbackUrl. GET or POST .

parameters.name: CallSid
parameters.description: Show only recordings made during the call given by this sid.

parameters.name: DateCreated
parameters.description: Only show recordings created on the given date. Should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD . You can also specify inequality, such as DateCreated<=YYYY-MM-DD for recordings generated at or before midnight on a date, and DateCreated>=YYYY-MM-DD for recordings generated at or after midnight on a date.

parameters.name: AnsweredBy
parameters.description: The result of answering machine detection. If Enable was specified, results can be: machine_start , human , fax , unknown . If DetectMessageEnd was specified, results can be: machine_end_beep , machine_end_silence , machine_end_other , human , fax , unknown .

parameters.name: VoiceUrl
parameters.description: The URL Twilio will request when this domain receives a call.

parameters.name: VoiceMethod
parameters.description: The HTTP method Twilio will use when requesting the above Url. Either GET or POST .

parameters.name: VoiceFallbackUrl
parameters.description: The URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs retrieving or executing the TwiML requested by VoiceUrl.

parameters.name: VoiceFallbackMethod
parameters.description: The HTTP method Twilio will use when requesting the VoiceFallbackUrl. Either GET or POST .

parameters.name: VoiceStatusCallbackUrl
parameters.description: The URL that Twilio will request to pass status parameters (such as call ended) to your application.

parameters.name: VoiceStatusCallbackMethod
parameters.description: The HTTP method Twilio will use to make requests to the StatusCallback URL. Either GET or POST .

parameters.name: StartDate
parameters.description: The first date for which feedback entries are included in this Feedback Summary, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. All dates are in UTC.

parameters.name: EndDate
parameters.description: The last date for which feedback entries are included in this Feedback Summary, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. All dates are in UTC.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The Account that reported the feedback entry.

parameters.name: IncludeSubaccounts
parameters.description: true if the feedback summary includes subaccounts, false otherwise.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description: The status of the feedback summary can be queued, in-progress, completed, or failed.

parameters.name: CallCount
parameters.description: The total number of calls.

parameters.name: CallFeedbackCount
parameters.description: The total number of calls with a feedback entry.

parameters.name: QualityScoreAverage
parameters.description: The average QualityScore of the feedback entries.

parameters.name: QualityScoreMedian
parameters.description: The median QualityScore of the feedback entries.

parameters.name: QualityScoreStandardDeviation
parameters.description: The standard deviation of the quality scores.

parameters.name: Issues
parameters.description: A list of all the issues experienced. The list includes the issue name, the number of occurrences and percentage of calls that experienced this issue.

parameters.name: CredentialListSid
parameters.description: The Sid of the CredentialList that you want to associated with this domain. Once associated, Twilio will start authenticating access to the domain against this list.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Only retrieve the list of port orders in this state. Possible values: 1. Created, 2. Received, 3. Submitting, 4. Submitted, 5. Delivered, 6. Completed, 7. Canceled, 8. Rejected, 9. Failed

parameters.name: activation_date
parameters.description: Only retrieve the list of port orders comprising phone numbers that are scheduled to become active on a particular date, in ISO 8601 format, e.g., activation_date=2009-07-06. Inequality can also be specified to retrieve the list of port orders comprising phone numbers that are scheduled to become active on or before midnight on a particular date, e.g. activation_date<=2009-07-06, or to retrieve the list of port orders comprising phone numbers that are scheduled to become active on or after midnight on a particular date, e.g. activation_date>=2009-07-06.

parameters.name: friendly_name
parameters.description: Only retrieve the list of port orders with this friendly name.

parameters.name: date_created
parameters.description: Only retrieve the list of port orders that were created on a particular date, in ISO 8601 format, e.g., date_created=2009-07-06. Inequality can be specified to retrieve the list of port orders that were created before or after a particular date as well.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: Only retrieve the list of port orders that comprise this porting phone number. This must be in E.164 format, e.g., +16175551212.

parameters.name: before_sid
parameters.description: Only retrieve port orders before the port order with this SID in the list of all port orders.

parameters.name: after_sid
parameters.description: Only retrieve port orders after the port order with this SID in the list of all port orders.

parameters.name: IpAddress
parameters.description: An IP address in dotted decimal notation from which you want to accept traffic. Any SIP requests from this IP address will be allowed by Twilio. IPv4 only supported today.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: Porting phone number in E.164 format, e.g., +16175551212.

parameters.name: iso_country
parameters.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code in the service address associated with the porting phone number, e.g., US.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Name of the region in the service address associated with the porting phone number. This can be a 2 letter state code in US, e.g., CA.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Name of the city in the service address associated with the porting phone number.

parameters.name: postal_code
parameters.description: Zip code or postal code in the service address associated with the porting phone number.

parameters.name: street
parameters.description: Name of the street in the service address associated with the porting phone number.

parameters.name: first_name
parameters.description: First name of the person that owns the porting phone number. Please note that this is the name we will use to populate the “First Name” field in the LOA associated with this port request, and that this person must be the one who is authorized to and will sign the LOA.

parameters.name: last_name
parameters.description: Last name of the person that owns the porting phone number. Please note that this is the name we will use to populate the “Last Name” field in the LOA associated with this port request, and that this person must be the one who is authorized to and will sign the LOA.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email address of the person that owns the porting phone number. Please note that this person must be the one who is authorized to and will sign the LOA.

parameters.name: AreaCode
parameters.description: Find phone numbers in the specified area code.

parameters.name: Contains
parameters.description: A pattern to match phone numbers on. Valid characters are '*' and [0-9a-zA-Z] . The '*' character will match any single digit. See Example 2 below.

parameters.name: SmsEnabled
parameters.description: This indicates whether the phone numbers can receive text messages. Possible values are true or false .

parameters.name: MmsEnabled
parameters.description: This indicates whether the phone numbers can receive MMS messages. Possible values are true or false .

parameters.name: VoiceEnabled
parameters.description: This indicates whether the phone numbers can receive calls. Possible values are true or false .

parameters.name: ExcludeAllAddressRequired
parameters.description: Indicates whether the response includes phone numbers which require any Address . Possible values are true or false . If not specified, the default is false , and results could include phone numbers with an Address required.

parameters.name: ExcludeLocalAddressRequired
parameters.description: Indicates whether the response includes phone numbers which require a local Address . Possible values are true or false . If not specified, the default is false , and results could include phone numbers with a local Address required.

parameters.name: ExcludeForeignAddressRequired
parameters.description: Indicates whether the response includes phone numbers which require a foreign Address . Possible values are true or false . If not specified, the default is false , and results could include phone numbers with a foreign Address required.

parameters.name: Beta
parameters.description: Include phone numbers new to the Twilio platform. Possible values are either true or false . Default is true .

parameters.name: Muted
parameters.description: Only show participants that are muted or unmuted. Either true or false .

parameters.name: Hold
parameters.description: Only show participants that are held or unheld. Either true or false .

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description: Only show conferences currently in with this status. May be in-progress , or completed .

parameters.name: FriendlyName
parameters.description: List conferences whose FriendlyName exactly matches this string.

parameters.name: DateCreated
parameters.description: Only show conferences that started on this date, given as YYYY-MM-DD . You can also specify inequality, such as DateCreated<=YYYY-MM-DD for conferences that started at or before midnight on a date, and DateCreated>=YYYY-MM-DD for conferences that started at or after midnight on a date.

parameters.name: DateUpdated
parameters.description: Only show conferences that were last updated on this date, given as YYYY-MM-DD . You can also specify inequality, such as DateUpdated<=YYYY-MM-DD for conferences that were last updated at or before midnight on a date, and DateUpdated>=YYYY-MM-DD for conferences that were updated at or after midnight on a date.

parameters.name: Category
parameters.description: Only include usage of this usage category .

parameters.name: StartDate
parameters.description: Only include usage that has occurred on or after this date. Format is YYYY-MM-DD. All dates are in GMT. As a convenience, you can also specify offsets to today. For example, StartDate=-30days will make StartDate be 30 days before today.

parameters.name: EndDate
parameters.description: Only include usage that has occurred on or before this date. Format is YYYY-MM-DD. All dates are in GMT. As a convenience, you can also specify offsets to today. For example, EndDate=+30days will make EndDate be 30 days from today.

parameters.name: IncludeSubaccounts
parameters.description: true to include usage from the master account and all subaccounts. false to only retrieve usage from the specified account. IncludeSubaccounts is true by default.

parameters.name: Only return the Address resources with friendly names that exactly match this name.
parameters.description: Only return the Address resources with friendly names that exactly match this name.

parameters.name: Only return the Address resources in this country.
parameters.description: Only return the Address resources in this country.

parameters.name: PhoneNumber
parameters.description: Only show the caller id resource that exactly matches this phone number.

parameters.name: FriendlyName
parameters.description: Only show the caller id resource that exactly matches this name.

parameters.name: To
parameters.description: The destination phone number. Format with a '+' and country code e.g., +16175551212 ( E.164 format).

parameters.name: To
parameters.description: Only show SMS messages to this phone number.

parameters.name: From
parameters.description: Only show SMS messages from this phone number.

parameters.name: DateSent
parameters.description: Only show SMS messages sent on this date (in GMT format), given as YYYY-MM-DD . Example: DateSent=2009-07-06 . You can also specify inequality, such as DateSent<=YYYY-MM-DD for SMS messages that were sent on or before midnight on a date, and DateSent>=YYYY-MM-DD for SMS messages sent on or after midnight on a date.

parameters.name: PhoneNumberSid
parameters.description: PhoneNumberSid Phone Number SID for the Phone Number being added to the Service.

parameters.name: The password that the username will use when when authenticating SIP requests. The password must be a minimum of 12 characters, contain at least 1 digit, and have mixed case. (eg “IWasAtTwilioCon2011”)
parameters.description: The password that the username will use when when authenticating SIP requests. The password must be a minimum of 12 characters, contain at least 1 digit, and have mixed case. (eg “IWasAtTwilioCon2011”)

parameters.name: NearNumber
parameters.description: Given a phone number, find a geographically close number within Distance miles. Distance defaults to 25 miles.

parameters.name: NearLatLong
parameters.description: Given a latitude/longitude pair lat,long find geographically close numbers within Distance miles.

parameters.name: Distance
parameters.description: Specifies the search radius for a Near- query in miles. If not specified this defaults to 25 miles. Maximum searchable distance is 500 miles.

parameters.name: InPostalCode
parameters.description: Limit results to a particular postal code. Given a phone number, search within the same postal code as that number.

parameters.name: InRegion
parameters.description: Limit results to a particular region (i.e. State/Province). Given a phone number, search within the same Region as that number.

parameters.name: InRateCenter
parameters.description: Limit results to a specific rate center, or given a phone number search within the same rate center as that number. Requires InLata to be set as well.

parameters.name: InLata
parameters.description: Limit results to a specific Local access and transport area ( LATA ). Given a phone number, search within the same LATA as that number.

parameters.name: AlphaSender
parameters.description: An Alphanumeric Sender ID string, up to 11 characters. Valid characters are A-Z, a-z, 0-9, space and dash ( - ). An Alphanumeric Sender ID string cannot be comprised of only numbers.

parameters.name: unconfirmed
parameters.description: The message has not yet arrived at the To phone number. Note that this may mean the message has failed or it is still pending. For the purposes of the Message Feedback API, these two states are considered the same. Your application should not POST this value as it will be automatically set when the initial HTTP POST is includes ProvideFeedback=true .

parameters.name: confirmed
parameters.description: The message has arrived at the To phone number. Even if the message is delayed in delivery, you should still POST this value as soon as you have confirmed that the message was received.

parameters.name: imperfect-audio
parameters.description: Imperfect audio quality: Choppy, echoed, or garbled audio during conversation.

parameters.name: dropped-call
parameters.description: Dropped call: call initially connected but was dropped.

parameters.name: incorrect-caller-id
parameters.description: Incorrect caller ID: Call connected but caller ID displayed ‘Unknown’ or an incorrect number.

parameters.name: post-dial-delay
parameters.description: Post dial delay: Call connected but there was a long delay between dialing the phone number and the start of ringing.

parameters.name: digits-not-captured
parameters.description: DTMF tones not captured: Failed to capture digit input on phone menus.

parameters.name: unsolicited-call
parameters.description: Unsolicited call: Received telemarketer, wrong number, automated or other type of unsolicited call.

parameters.name: audio-latency
parameters.description: Audio latency: Call participants can hear each other but with significant audio delay.

parameters.name: one-way-audio
parameters.description: One way audio: Only one party could hear the audio during the conversation.

parameters.name: FallbackUrl
parameters.description: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML at Url .

parameters.name: FallbackMethod
parameters.description: The HTTP method that Twilio should use to request the FallbackUrl . Must be either GET or POST . Defaults to POST .

parameters.name: StatusCallback
parameters.description: A URL that Twilio will request when the call ends to notify your app.

parameters.name: StatusCallbackMethod
parameters.description: The HTTP method Twilio should use when requesting the above URL. Defaults to POST .

parameters.name: AuthorizeRedirectUrl
parameters.description: The URL the user's browser will redirect to after Twilio authenticates the user and obtains authorization for this Connect App.

parameters.name: DeauthorizeCallbackUrl
parameters.description: The URL to which Twilio will send a request when a user de-authorizes this Connect App.

parameters.name: DeauthorizeCallbackMethod
parameters.description: The HTTP method to be used when making a request to the DeauthorizeCallbackUrl . Either GET or POST .

parameters.name: Permissions
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of permssions you will request from users of this ConnectApp. Valid permssions are get-all or post-all .

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: A more detailed human readable description of the Connect App.

parameters.name: CompanyName
parameters.description: The company name for this Connect App.

parameters.name: HomepageUrl
parameters.description: The public URL where users can obtain more information about this Connect App.

parameters.name: IpAccessControlListSid
parameters.description: The Sid of the IpAccessControlList that you want to associated with this domain. Once associated, Twilio will start authenticating access to the domain against this list.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: Your Twilio account id. It is 34 characters long, and always starts with the letters AC.

parameters.name: FeedbackSummarySid
parameters.description: The unique id of the Feedback Summary.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description: The status of the Feedback Summary; queued, in-progress, completed, or failed.

parameters.name: ResourceUri
parameters.description: The Feedback Summary Resource URI.

parameters.name: accepted
parameters.description: Twilio has received your API request to send a message with a Messaging Service and a From number is being dynamically selected. This is still the initial status when sending with a Messaging Service and the From parameter.

parameters.name: queued
parameters.description: The API request to send a message was successful and the message is queued to be sent out. This is the initial status when you are not using a Messaging Service.

parameters.name: sending
parameters.description: Twilio is in the process of dispatching your message to the nearest upstream carrier in the network.

parameters.name: sent
parameters.description: The message was successfully accepted by the nearest upstream carrier.

parameters.name: receiving
parameters.description: The inbound message has been received by Twilio and is currently being processed.

parameters.name: received
parameters.description: On inbound messages only. The inbound message was received by one of your Twilio numbers.

parameters.name: delivered
parameters.description: Twilio has received confirmation of message delivery from the upstream carrier, and, where available, the destination handset.

parameters.name: undelivered
parameters.description: Twilio has received a delivery receipt indicating that the message was not delivered. This can happen for a number of reasons including carrier content filtering, availability of the destination handset, etc.

parameters.name: failed
parameters.description: The message could not be sent. This can happen for various reasons including queue overflows, account suspensions and media errors (in the case of MMS). Twilio does not charge you for failed messages.

parameters.name: Beta
parameters.description: If true , only include countries where phone numbers new to the Twilio platform are available. If false , do not include new inventory.

info: This is the information of the API
